title: Why2why
author: Why2why
content: Just a harmless question and I will be glad to read what your understanding of the topic is, and just as the title goes.Who else are the bitcoin developers aside from satoshi and what are their role in the bitcoin network at the moment.

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: 1) Satoshi Nakamoto2) Gavin Andresen3) laszloh4) sirius Martti Malm Source

comments.author: Hazink
comments.body: According to  Aug 23, 2009 – Jan 22, 2024  from github they about a total of 96 of them which the names will be posted below.. don’t know if screenshot will be better or just typing them which will be time consuming.Code:1.laanwj2. fanquake3. sipa4. hebasto5. achow1016. gavinandresen7. jnewbery8. jonasschnelli9. practicalswift10. jonatack11. theuni12. dongcarl13. ryanofskyYou can get the rest from the link above…

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Bitcoin is a decentralized projects and it's impossible to list all devs.You can see some most prominent Bitcoin developers therehttps://bitcoindevlist.com/If you appreciate their works, donate some satoshis to their addresses.

comments.author: JunaidAzizi
comments.body: Quote from: hd49728 on January 23, 2024, 01:29:31 AMBitcoin is a decentralized projects and it's impossible to list all devs.You can see some most prominent Bitcoin developers therehttps://bitcoindevlist.com/If you appreciate their works, donate some satoshis to their addresses.Satoshi Nakamoto is the thinker and founder of the Bitcoin decentralized project and he is the main role in this project. A lot of other people also worked with Satoshi and now they all are working on the Bitcoin network in different sectors like research, design, development, identifying valuernabelities, etc and it is very hard to post all of them here. Some developers did not want to share their identities and remain hidden like Satoshi Nakamoto no one can know where he is, or whether he is alive or dead don't know and now the Bitcoin network is run by these developers whom we call "Bitcoin Core Development Team". So if someone wants to know about them just go through the link you will find them and also if you want to appreciate them send some satoshi to their addresses.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Quote from: Hazink on January 22, 2024, 10:17:47 PMAccording to  Aug 23, 2009 – Jan 22, 2024  from github they about a total of 96 of them which the names will be posted below.. don’t know if screenshot will be better or just typing them which will be time consuming. Providing screenshot also takes time too I think since you need to screenshot more than once for all devs to be seen. I think it's better if you type each name like this "reply to the thread and use the BBcode (/code) and open new window for the site that you provided and just scroll when you need to type the rest of the devs name.  For screenshot, uploading to talkimg for example and use the img BBcode and then paste the link of the image uploaded. If you ask me what I would do is I'll do what you did but up to 20 devs starting from number 1 to number 20 and then provide the link. I am sure you know that Satoshi started the Bitcoin being a dev with some help if I am correct and then later on, other devs started contributing for Bitcoin network.

comments.author: Why2why
comments.body: I appreciate all you all for your efforts on this thread, I thought I have read enough last night, but now I am still seeing alot of interesting replies and I am happy that my level of enlightenment on the subject matter have increased and still is, I appreciate y'all.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I think that your question and the answers of others revolve around bitcoinCore, which we can say that the first developers were Satoshi and Martti Malmi, and after that the developers contributed to the open source code, which was not on github, but rather http://sourceforge.net.Quote from: satoshi on December 16, 2009, 10:45:36 PMMartti Malmi - Minimize to system tray option - Setup program for Windows - Linux version (tested on Ubuntu)Satoshi Nakamoto - Multi-processor support for coin generation - Proxy support for use with TOR - Fixed some slowdowns in the initial block downloadThe rest of the developers came after that

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on January 23, 2024, 08:08:53 AMI think that your question and the answers of others revolve around bitcoinCore, which we can say that the first developers were Satoshi and Martti Malmi, and after that the developers contributed to the open source code, which was not on github, but rather http://sourceforge.net.The rest of the developers came after thatRest developers are like Gavin Andresen who left the forum and joined other projects too. He talked about Bitcoin in front of CIA. Gavin was fooled by Roger Ver and Faketoshi Craig Wright but his contributions for Bitcoin in the past are undeniable.And gmaxwell who is still here and developing Bitcoin Core.His interview with information about his adventure with Bitcoin.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Quote from: Why2why on January 22, 2024, 10:08:53 PMJust a harmless question and I will be glad to read what your understanding of the topic is, and just as the title goes.Who else are the bitcoin developers aside from satoshi and what are their role in the bitcoin network at the moment.I see that a list has been provided below. But I want to add couple of things which might clear out couple of confusions you may have after knowing that there is a development team for Bitcoin. Bitcoin developers cannot implement of force any change into the network. What they can do is to make the required changes in the algorithm and pass it to the Bitcoin network for reaching consensus. If 51% of the miners agree to the change, that is accepted in the network. Those who do not agree, they will fork out. So even if a list of developers is available, Bitcoin is still decentralized.

comments.author: johnsaributua
comments.body: Many people are instrumental in creating bitcoin and developing it, I understand the meaning of anonymity including protecting the ranks of the team in it even though they share a username but I believe that they are still working very hard until now to keep bitcoin growing forward from year to year. Although crypto is not all like that, especially altcoin developers openly open their identities but that is entirely their own responsibility. However, bitcoin gets treatment and market trust that is timeless despite the fact that bitcoin has more great people behind the scenes that's for sure, but I look at the knowledge that flows in this forum.Although all are anonymous but the knowledge of bitcoin and its mechanisms is so genius and I admire it, is very useful for my daily needs, bitcoin for me is a real economy and a very effective source of accountants. Also indirectly bitcoin holders and traders for me are also effective developers even though from outside the team and make a lot of buyers, I agree that the development of bitcoin is due to the genius maker and the activities of bitcoin owners who work well all the time. Thank you bitcoin developers.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: This article is rather old, but it also contains who play them and IMO it's well written. Who Funds Bitcoin Development?. And while Bitcoin Core isn't official Bitcoin full node software, list of contributor is stated on Bitcoin Core release note. An example, https://bitcoincore.org/en/releases/26.0/.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Too many to mention. Some of them already made their own company, that still supports bitcoin and mainstream crypto. As bitcoin is open source, expect more and more developers will contribute or then will leave later on, only a few who will have a lead roles but they are still known as "bitcoin developers".Well, dont' forget our very own that is still active mods and developer till now — achow101 and gmaxwell.

comments.author: WhyFhy
comments.body: Well here's a pretty important name that seems to have gotten overlooked here at least.Hal FinneyHe laid some of the groundwork down without a doubt!He was even the first person to receive Bitcoin. In fact a lot of people wonder(myself included) if he's Satoshi!Thank you Hal.*Hals not even honorably mentioned it seems , but he invented PoW, PGP was likely Hal as well he and Phil got investigated by the FBI for it in 1991. Hal was working for Phil.Harold's just way to involved as a whole to not be mentioned and that bothers me.

comments.author: CODE200
comments.body: Quote from: hd49728 on January 23, 2024, 01:29:31 AMBitcoin is a decentralized projects and it's impossible to list all devs.There's already a contributor list in Github so how it's impossible to list them? @Hazink already got the link to the contributors list so I don't think it's true, maybe the word is difficult, impossible implies that there's no way to list them all. I'm curious with how many developers there are too, bitcoin is a decentralized project after all so that means that anyone can contribute to the development and I like that it's this way, it don't matter what your fame is, you're always welcome to do your part. I have a question, is there no confusion with a lot of developers working on the source code? Don't their works overlap or mess with other codes?

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: CODE200 on February 19, 2024, 02:09:57 AMQuote from: hd49728 on January 23, 2024, 01:29:31 AMBitcoin is a decentralized projects and it's impossible to list all devs.There's already a contributor list in Github so how it's impossible to list them?1. Not everyone use GitHub. If you check non-github-bitcoin on GitHub[1], it's dummy account for contributor who don't have GitHub account.2. In wider context, anyone who write Bitcoin application could be considered as Bitcoin developer. Even to create list all Bitcoin application would be challenging.3. Some Bitcoin project intentionally avoid GitHub to host it's source code since for various reason.[1] https://github.com/non-github-bitcoin
